Experiment Method.Assay Method: Fibrillization Assay with Thioflavin S Fluorescence

Material used.Description: Purified WT and mutant α-synuclein (1 mg/ml) were incubated at 37 °C with shaking.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutation showed slower fibrillization compared to WT, but A30P seeds accelerated WT fibrillization more effectively than WT seeds.
E46K mutation fibrillized faster than WT, but its seeds had a weaker effect on WT fibrillization compared to A30P seeds.
A53T mutation fibrillized faster than WT, with seeding effects similar to WT seeds on WT fibrillization.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are expressed as means ± S.E. of three independent experiments (n = 3).

Basic negative control.Description: Fibrillization was not observed in the absence of seeds.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Comparable fibrillization rate to WT α-synuclein under standard conditions.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly slower or faster fibrillization rate compared to WT α-synuclein.

Material used.Material Name: WT and Mutant α-Synuclein Fibrils and Seeds
Material used.Description: Fibrils, seeds, and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were diluted in 30 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.5, and observed with a JEOL 1200EXII electron microscope.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P fibrils showed higher shedding of tiny fragments compared to WT, contributing to faster seeding of WT fibrillization.
E46K fibrils showed longer morphology with less shedding compared to A30P.
A53T fibrils showed longer morphology with less shedding compared to A30P.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Uniform long fibrils similar to WT α-synuclein.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of short or tiny fibrils indicating high shedding propensity.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Dot Blot Assay with Epitope-Specific Antibodies

Material used.Material Name: WT and Mutant α-Synuclein Fibrils and Seeds
Material used.Description: α-Synuclein monomer, seeds, and fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were spotted onto polyvinylidene difluoride membrane and probed with epitope-specific antibodies.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P fibrils showed a distinct conformation compared to WT fibrils, with stronger labeling by N-terminal antibodies and weaker by NAC region antibodies.
Specific conformational analysis for E46K not detailed in the context of dot blot assay.
Specific conformational analysis for A53T not detailed in the context of dot blot assay.

Biological replicates.Description: Similar results were obtained in three separate experiments.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantification of immunoreactivities expressed as means ± S.E. (n = 3).

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Immunoreactivity pattern similar to WT α-synuclein fibrils.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Distinct immunoreactivity pattern compared to WT α-synuclein fibrils.

Material used.Material Name: WT and Mutant α-Synuclein Fibrils and Seeds
Material used.Description: Seeds or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds were treated with trypsin or proteinase K and subjected to SDS-PAGE.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P fibrils and WT fibrils formed with A30P seeds showed distinct protease-resistant core band patterns compared to WT fibrils.
Specific protease-resistant core analysis for E46K not detailed.
Specific protease-resistant core analysis for A53T not detailed.

Biological replicates.Description: Similar results were obtained in three separate experiments.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protease-resistant band pattern similar to WT α-synuclein fibrils.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Distinct protease-resistant band pattern compared to WT α-synuclein fibrils.

Material used.Description: SH-SY5Y cells cultured in a 96-well microtiter plate were treated with 500 nM α-synuclein monomer, fibrils, or fibrils formed in the presence of seeds.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P fibrils showed stronger cytotoxicity compared to WT and other mutant fibrils, with enhanced toxicity upon sonication.
E46K fibrils showed significant cytotoxicity, though less than A30P, with minimal increase upon sonication.
A53T fibrils showed significant cytotoxicity, though less than A30P.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are expressed as means ± S.E. (n = 3).

Basic negative control.Description: No toxicity was detected with monomeric WT or mutant α-synuclein.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired Student's t-test was used for statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: MTT reduction comparable to control (30 mM Tris-HCl, pH 7.5).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant reduction in MTT (p < 0.01) compared to control.
